text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the official Vietnamese press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- Communist Party General Secretary Do Muoi has re-affirmed Vietnam's determination to pursue a multi-sector economy managed by the state and in accordance with socialist philosophy.
-- China has said it will talk with Vietnam about the dispute over a offshore area where China is drilling for oil.
-- James Hall, Deputy Chief of Mission at the U.S Embassy in Hanoi said the U.S wants to invest in projects in central Vietnam.

-- A seminar on "Exporting Vietnamese Goods to the U.S." which is to be held by the UNDP and the Ministry of Science, Technology and Environment in Ho Chi Minh City on April 16 is expected to atract 100 manufacturers of consumer goods.
-- The Ho Chi Minh City Court of Appeal upheld death sentences for four ringleaders in the Tamexco fraud scandal and prison terms for other defendants.
-- Prime Minister Vo Van Kiet calls for speedy site clearance on the section Thu Duc-Binh Chanh section of National Highway 1 for upgrading work to get under way before May 1.
